trans-unit.source: Navigate and select Azure virtual machine images with PowerShell and the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Navigate and select Azure virtual machine images with PowerShell and the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: Learn how to determine the publisher, offer, and SKU for images when creating an Azure virtual machine with Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to determine the publisher, offer, and SKU for images when creating an Azure virtual machine with Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Navigate and select Azure virtual machine images with Windows PowerShell and the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Navigate and select Azure virtual machine images with Windows PowerShell and the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: When you're searching for virtual machine images in this topic, you're using the <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager mode</linkText><title></title></link> with a recent installation of either the Azure Command-Line interface for Mac, Linux, and Windows or of Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: When you're searching for virtual machine images in this topic, you're using the <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager mode</linkText><title></title></link> with a recent installation of either the Azure Command-Line interface for Mac, Linux, and Windows or of Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: With the Azure CLI, enter that mode by typing azure config mode arm.
trans-unit.target: With the Azure CLI, enter that mode by typing azure config mode arm.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Using Azure CLI with Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> for more complete update and configuration details.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Using Azure CLI with Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> for more complete update and configuration details.

trans-unit.source: The easiest and quickest way to locate an image to use either with azure vm quick-create or to create a resource group template file is to call the azure vm image list command and pass the location, the publisher name (it's not case-sensitive!), and an offer -- if you know the offer.
trans-unit.target: The easiest and quickest way to locate an image to use either with azure vm quick-create or to create a resource group template file is to call the azure vm image list command and pass the location, the publisher name (it's not case-sensitive!), and an offer -- if you know the offer.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following list is only a short example -- many lists are quite long -- if you know that "Canonical" is a publisher for the "UbuntuServer" offer.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following list is only a short example -- many lists are quite long -- if you know that "Canonical" is a publisher for the "UbuntuServer" offer.

trans-unit.source: The Urn column will be the form you pass to azure vm quick-create.
trans-unit.target: The Urn column will be the form you pass to azure vm quick-create.

trans-unit.source: Often, however, you don't yet know what is available.
trans-unit.target: Often, however, you don't yet know what is available.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you can navigate images by discovering publishers first by using azure vm image list-publishers and responding to the location prompt with a data center location you expect to use for your resource group.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you can navigate images by discovering publishers first by using azure vm image list-publishers and responding to the location prompt with a data center location you expect to use for your resource group.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following lists all image publishers in the West US location (pass the location argument by lowercasing and removing spaces from the standard locations)
trans-unit.target: For example, the following lists all image publishers in the West US location (pass the location argument by lowercasing and removing spaces from the standard locations)

trans-unit.source: These lists can be quite long, so the example list above is just a snippet.
trans-unit.target: These lists can be quite long, so the example list above is just a snippet.

trans-unit.source: Let's say that I noticed that Canonical is, indeed, an image publisher in the West US location.
trans-unit.target: Let's say that I noticed that Canonical is, indeed, an image publisher in the West US location.

trans-unit.source: You can now find their offers by calling azure vm image list-offers and pass the location and the publisher at the prompts, like the following example:
trans-unit.target: You can now find their offers by calling azure vm image list-offers and pass the location and the publisher at the prompts, like the following example:

trans-unit.source: Now we know that in the West US region, Canonical publishes the UbuntuServer offer on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Now we know that in the West US region, Canonical publishes the UbuntuServer offer on Azure.

trans-unit.source: To get those, you call azure vm image list-skus and respond to the prompt with the location, publisher, and offer that you have discovered.
trans-unit.target: To get those, you call azure vm image list-skus and respond to the prompt with the location, publisher, and offer that you have discovered.

trans-unit.source: With this information, you can now find exactly the image you want by calling the original call at the top.
trans-unit.target: With this information, you can now find exactly the image you want by calling the original call at the top.

trans-unit.source: Now you can choose precisely the image you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Now you can choose precisely the image you want to use.

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual machine quickly by using the URN information, which you just found, or to use a template with that URN information, see <link><linkText>Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual machine quickly by using the URN information, which you just found, or to use a template with that URN information, see <link><linkText>Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This video demonstrates the above steps using the CLI.
trans-unit.target: This video demonstrates the above steps using the CLI.

trans-unit.source: When creating a new virtual machine with Azure Resource Manager, in some cases you need to specify an image with the combination of the following image properties:
trans-unit.target: When creating a new virtual machine with Azure Resource Manager, in some cases you need to specify an image with the combination of the following image properties:

trans-unit.source: For example, these values are needed for the Set-AzureVMSourceImage PowerShell cmdlet or with a resource group template file in which you must specify the type of virtual machine to be created.
trans-unit.target: For example, these values are needed for the Set-AzureVMSourceImage PowerShell cmdlet or with a resource group template file in which you must specify the type of virtual machine to be created.

trans-unit.source: If you need to determine these values, you can navigate the images to determine these values:
trans-unit.target: If you need to determine these values, you can navigate the images to determine these values:

trans-unit.source: For a given publisher, list their offers.
trans-unit.target: For a given publisher, list their offers.

trans-unit.source: For a given offer, list their SKUs.
trans-unit.target: For a given offer, list their SKUs.

trans-unit.source: To do this in PowerShell, first switch to the Resource Manager mode of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: To do this in PowerShell, first switch to the Resource Manager mode of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For the first step above, list the publishers with these commands.
trans-unit.target: For the first step above, list the publishers with these commands.

trans-unit.source: Fill in your chosen publisher name and run these commands.
trans-unit.target: Fill in your chosen publisher name and run these commands.

trans-unit.source: Fill in your chosen offer name and run these commands.
trans-unit.target: Fill in your chosen offer name and run these commands.

trans-unit.source: From the display of the Get-AzureVMImageSku command, you have all the information you need to specify the image for a new virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: From the display of the Get-AzureVMImageSku command, you have all the information you need to specify the image for a new virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: From this list, copy the chosen SKU name, and you have all the information for the Set-AzureVMSourceImage PowerShell cmdlet or for a resource group template file that requires you to specify the publisher, offer, and SKU for an image.
trans-unit.target: From this list, copy the chosen SKU name, and you have all the information for the Set-AzureVMSourceImage PowerShell cmdlet or for a resource group template file that requires you to specify the publisher, offer, and SKU for an image.

trans-unit.source: This video demonstrates the above steps using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This video demonstrates the above steps using PowerShell.
